selected_quotes: Emerging evidence that mechanical tension and metabolic stress have differential effects on anabolic signaling.
Resistance Exercise Intensity Metabolic Stress on Anabolic Signaling the Expression of Myogenic Genes in Muscle
2/2 Tanto la intensidad como el estrés metabólico son herramientas para mejorar la señal ANABÓLICA muscular .
Influence of Resistance Exercise on Anabolic Signaling Expression of Myogenic Genes in Skeletal Muscle @AANEMorg

citation.abstract: Introduction: We investigated the effect of resistance exercise intensity and exercise-induced metabolic stress on the activation of anabolic signaling and expression of myogenic genes in skeletal muscle. Methods: 10 strength-trained athletes performed high-intensity [HI, 74% of 1 repetition maximum (RM)], middle-intensity (MI, 54% 1RM), or middle-intensity (54% 1RM) no-relaxation exercise (MIR). Kinase phosphorylation level and myogenic gene expression in muscle samples were evaluated before, 45 min, 5h, and 20 h after exercise. Results: The lactate concentration in MI was approximately 2-fold lower than in the 2 other sessions, and it was highest in MIR. The phosphorylation level of extracellular kinase 1/2(Thr202/Tyr204) after exercise was related to metabolic stress. Metabolic stress induced a decrease in myostatin mRNA expression, whereas mechano-growth factor mRNA level depended on exercise intensity. Conclusion: This study demonstrates that both intensity and exercise-induced metabolic stress can be manipulated to affect muscle anabolic signaling. © 2014 Wiley Periodicals, Inc.
citation.title: The Influence of Resistance Exercise Intensity and Metabolic Stress on Anabolic Signaling and the Expression of Myogenic Genes in Skeletal Muscle.
